thread.title: Rams should try to target wide receiver DeSean Jackson in free agency
thread.title_full: Rams should try to target wide receiver DeSean Jackson in free agency

title: Rams should try to target wide receiver DeSean Jackson in free agency
text:
Rams should try to target wide receiver DeSean Jackson in free agency Rams should try to target wide receiver DeSean Jackson in free agency By Bryan Kalbrosky 3 hours ago 147 shares By: Bryan Kalbrosky | 3 hours ago 
One of the first moves from Los Angeles Rams head coach Sean McVay could be signing wide receiver DeSean Jackson in upcoming free agency. 
Donté Stallworth, who played for McVay in 2011, had positive things to say about the new Rams head coach. Here's former Redskin @DonteStallworth on new Rams coach Sean McVay … pic.twitter.com/6BlzvLRb3d 
— Albert Breer (@AlbertBreer) January 12, 2017 
Washington has two wide receivers eligible for free agency in the upcoming offseason: Jackson and Pierre Garcon. 
Both are currently on the wrong side of 30. But it’s unlikely that they would re-sign both wideouts. Related: Which free agent wide receivers should the Rams target this offseason? 
Jackson averaged 17.9 yards per reception this year, which beats the 13.2 from Garcon. 
He also currently makes $6 million per season — which is less than the $8.5 million that Washington pays Garcon. One note, w/ McVay set to be coach: #Rams will probably be looking for a WR in free agency. DeSean Jackson, an LA native, loved McVay in DC. 
— Ryan Kartje (@Ryan_Kartje) January 12, 2017 
The market value for Jackson is $22.8 million over three years for an average annual salary of $7.6 million ( via Spotrac ). 
That’s comparable to the $6.7 million estimate for Kenny Britt, who is a free agent as well. 
Jackson, however, is from Los Angeles and recently had over 1,000 yards while playing under McVay. Here's @DeSeanJackson11 on new Rams head coach Sean McVay. pic.twitter.com/smhMG0EcWI 
— Erin Hawksworth (@ABC7Erin) January 12, 2017 
Jackson also reportedly personally called McVay to congratulate him on the new job ( via ABC7NEWS ). 
According to Pro Football Focus rankings, Garcon was the No. 8 overall receiver in the NFL this season. 
Jackson received a grade of 77.0 — comparable with New England’s Julian Edelman, Cleveland’s Terrelle Pryor and Chicago’s Alshon Jeffery. It’s higher than Kenny Britt, who received a 76.5. Related:
